meanings.definition: To drive faster or farther than someone else.
meanings.sent1: She was outdriving her friends on the highway.
meanings.sent2: The car outdriving the others reached the finish line first.
meanings.sent3: The turtle joked that it was outdriving the hare in the race.
meanings.sent4: His determination was outdriving any obstacles in his path.
meanings.sent5: The rocket outdriving gravity soared into the sky.

meanings.definition: To hit a golf ball farther than someone else.
meanings.sent1: He was outdriving his golfing buddies with his powerful swing.
meanings.sent2: The professional golfer was outdriving his competitors with ease.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel outdriving the golfer by hitting acorns instead of golf balls.
meanings.sent4: Her golf ball was outdriving the wind, sailing far across the green.
meanings.sent5: The golf club's new technology was outdriving all expectations.
